head.supplied: 6./8/61 ¶ Dear Sir ¶ ¶ Miss Maund desires me to present the bye following work of her father and Prof Henslow to the public Library. ¶ If you have already any portion of these plates & pages now for...

div.p: VPRS 5831/PO/1, p. 11 miscellaneous inward correspondence, Trustees of the Public Library, Museums and National Gallery, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: Augustus Tulk was Librarian at the Public Library, Melbourne, at this time. 6./8/61

Miss Maund desires me to present the bye following work of her father and Prof Henslow to the public Library.
Maund & Henslow (1836-42). The donation and other titles given by Miss Maund are recorded in Public Library of Victoria (1873), p. 134; the dates of the gifts are not noted. If you have already any portion of these plates & pages now forwarded, pray return them to me. I would be glad if you could forward an acknowledgement in time to be enclosed in my letter to Miss Maund by next mail.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
